article.headline: American 84, Yale 73
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP)-- Jernavis Draughn scored 17 points and grabbed seven rebounds as American won three straight for the first time this season by beating Yale 84-73 Saturday afternoon. Draughn's speed gave the Bulldogs (4-7) trouble on the inside as American (6-7)�went on first-half runs of 14-0 and 20-3 to lead by as many as 22. Dominick Martin scored 18 points to lead the Bulldogs, who tried to keep the first meeting between the two schools close by making 10 3-pointers on 23 attempts. The 10 3-pointers matched a season high for the Bulldogs, who equaled the mark in a loss to St. Peter's. Yale, which has now lost foõ99:¹°´34:¸:6¶22»4:´47?»4:´??¹²¶°4·4·34· the second half on two free throws by Edwin Draughan, but American's Matej Cresnik hit two 3-pointers and a short jumper to lead a 10-3 run American that pushed the lead back to 18. Andres Rodriguez and Andre Ingram scored 14 and 12 respectively for the Eagles, who had six different players score in double figures.
